1.title: Animal Tails
1.plot: We'll investigate some incredible animal tails and discover why some animals have them. - and some don't.

2.title: World's Strongest Animals
2.plot: We'll discover some of the strongest animals on the planet. Strength doesn't always mean muscles, either.

3.title: Animals Helping Animals
3.plot: We'll investigate some of the amazing and unexpected ways that animals help each other.

4.title: Animal Hybrids
4.plot: We meet dozens of animals that you'll have to see to believe as we look at some incredible real-life creatures that science likes to call "hybrid animals!"

5.title: Longest Living Animals
5.plot: We'll take an in-depth look at some of the longest living animals on the planet. From our coldest oceans, to our hottest deserts, and all point in-between.

6.title: World's Biggest Animals
6.plot: We'll investigate all creatures great - and by no means small as we discover some of the tallest, heaviest and record breaking animals on the planet.

7.title: Animal Builders
7.plot: We'll investigate some of the most amazing animal builders as we take a look at some of the most enormous animal construction projects on the planet.

8.title: Animal Climbers
8.plot: We'll investigate some of the most amazing animal climbers on the planet and discover an animal that can support its entire weight, just using one finger.

9.title: Animal Athletes
9.plot: It's time to find out who can dunk, dribble, and pass with the best of them. Plus, we'll jump, dive and shake a tail as we discover who's got what it takes to be called an animal athlete.

10.title: Dogs 101
10.plot: We'll investigate some of our favorite four-pawed friends, dogs. From breeds that dwarf them all in body size to others that dwarfs them all in ear size.

11.title: World's Showiest Animals
11.plot: We'll investigate some of the world's showiest critters as we examine all of the wacky, amazing ways these colorful characters showoff in the animal kingdom.

12.title: Group Hunters
12.plot: We'll enter the fray with a pack of wolves, get caught up in a feeding frenzy with a school of piranhas, and take to the skies with an aerial hunter as we investigate the group hunters of the animal world.

13.title: Animals in History
13.plot: We'll investigate some of the incredible ways that animals have helped shape human history and explore some of the most famous animals on the planet.

14.title: Mischievous Mammals
14.plot: We'll investigate some of nature's most mischievous mammals. From those that would risk a crocodile bite to steal eggs, to others that dig fake holes to trick predators and many more.

15.title: The Bear Necessities
15.plot: We'll investigate some of the most feared and revered animals on the planet: bears. From adorable pandas to fearsome grizzlies and every bear in between.

16.title: Life on the Reef
16.plot: We'll investigate life on the reef. From the tiniest animals, to the fiercest predators - coral reefs have it all.

17.title: Creepy Crawlers
17.plot: We'll investigate the creepy and the crawly as we meet some bugs. From the big to the small, to the beautiful and frightening, these critters are among the most fascinating forms of life on earth.

18.title: Animals of the World: The Amazon
18.plot: We'll investigate the Amazon rain forest and uncover some of the fascinating animals that live there.

19.title: Animals with Jobs
19.plot: We'll investigate some of the unexpected ways animals make themselves indispensable to our lives as meet some animals with jobs.

20.title: Top 10 Smelliest Animals
20.plot: We'll investigate some of the most interesting animals that produce some of the smelliest odors out in the animal kingdom.

21.title: Hop, Skip, and a Jump
21.plot: We'll investigate animal locomotion as we meet some of the most interesting animals on the planet that hop, skip, and jump.

22.title: Animals with Stripes
22.plot: We'll investigate animals with stripes. From animals with real stripes...to some that are just cheap knockoffs.

23.title: All About Bats
23.plot: We'll investigate bats. From bats that inspire scientists...to those that worry them. And we'll discover a special bat innovation that makes hanging out as relaxing as possible.

24.title: Animal Invaders
24.plot: We'll investigate some of the most invasive animal species on the planet. From one of Florida's biggest problems to a secret life of a particular toad.

25.title: Monkey Business
25.plot: We'll investigate some of the coolest primates in the animal kingdom: monkeys. We'll learn what's up with the proboscis monkey and meet the cutest monkey in the world.

26.title: Now You See It, Now You Don't
26.plot: We'll investigate some of the most disguised and concealed animals around the globe as we take a look into animal camouflage.

1.title: Animal Senses
1.plot: We'll test your senses about how animals see, hear and smell. Find out which animal uses it's eyes to swallow, which has ears on it's knees and which has a sense of smell 100,000 stronger than a human being's.

2.title: Animal Olympics
2.plot: We'll discover which animals run the fastest, jump the highest and dive the deepest. - and who has what it takes to be a championship boxer. We're picking our team for the Animal Olympics.

3.title: Big and Small
3.plot: We'll test your knowledge of all creatures GREAT and small. From the largest animals on the planet to the ones that are so tiny you can barely see them.

4.title: Animal Myths
4.plot: We're going to bust some animal myths. Can groundhogs really predict the weather? Do elephants never forget? Does the color red really make a bull angry? All this and many more animal myths.

5.title: Animal Sayings
5.plot: Sayings about animals. Say what? Have you ever heard the saying blind as a bat or sweat like a pig? Where and why did these sayings originate? We'll find out the truth behind these sayings and many more.

6.title: Animal Confusion
6.plot: We'll discover why some animals from different families are able to look alike, how to tell the difference between crocodiles and alligators, toads and frogs and more. Let's test your animal awareness.

7.title: Animal Groups
7.plot: We're talking animal groups. We'll explore why some animals prefer to live on their own, why some live in pairs, and why many live in groups. So get ready as we test your animal awareness of critter congregation.

8.title: Animal Bones
8.plot: All animals have skeletons of some sort and they come in all shapes. And all sizes. We're testing your animal awareness to see what you know about animal bones.

9.title: Animal Coverings
9.plot: Skin. Feathers. Scales. Every living thing has some kind of covering to protect it and we're going to test your critter comprehension and see what you know about animal coverings.

10.title: Animal Survival
10.plot: We'll investigate why animals go to extreme measures to survive in the wild. Which scaly animal migrates for weeks without eating? Which insect migrates over 3,000 miles? And more.

11.title: Animal Communication
11.plot: We're out to understand animal communication. Talk, talk, talk. Why do birds sing? Why do wolves howl?...and why do lightning bugs flash? Answers to these and more.

12.title: Domesticated and Wild
12.plot: We'll discover what makes wild animals wild and domestic animals...not. We'll also find out where house cats lived before houses, which animals can travel 200 mph through the air and more.

13.title: Animal Populations
13.plot: We're investigating animal populations and how they affect each other. We'll find out which fish is called the Dino fish, and why. Which reptile can live to be 100 years old and many more interactions.

14.title: Animal Movement
14.plot: We'll investigate how different animals move around in their environments? We'll also find out which bird is the only bird that can fly backwards? Which animal uses its jaw for navigation? . - and can frogs fly?

15.title: After the Dinosaurs
15.plot: We'll look at which animals survived the extinction event that killed all the dinosaurs, and we'll investigate just how they did it.

16.title: Animals in Disguise
16.plot: We'll investigate animal camouflage. We'll also find out how zebras got their stripes. How a stick can walk...and which snakes are the poisonous ones.

17.title: Animal Adaptation
17.plot: We'll discover why baby birds peep...find out just how many eggs fish really lay....and take a peek to learn what's going on inside a kangaroo's pouch.

18.title: Animal Diets
18.plot: We'll ask why the giraffe has such a long neck - see what else a skunk can do besides stink...and consider how to keep cool like a camel on the desert sands.

19.title: Animal Babies
19.plot: We'll investigate animal diets. What animals eat, how they eat it and why it's their favorite food. So join us at the table.

20.title: Animal Mysteries
20.plot: We'll find out why animals are so busy taking baths...discover how to dive to the depths of the ocean...and ask, is there such a thing as a living fossil?

21.title: Animal Societies and Families
21.plot: We'll horse around with a herd of horses...laugh with the hyenas...and get busy with a bunch of bees.

22.title: Animals and Us
22.plot: We'll dig up the origins of man's best friend...watch out for the man-eating tiger...and investigate how humans can share the planet with all of our furry, scaly, and feathery friends.

23.title: Animal Habitats
23.plot: We'll uncover the polar bear's secrets for living on the ice...dig up the dirt on why lizards live in the desert, and not the forest...and jump through the jungle to find the answers to why animals live where they live.

24.title: Animals in Your Neighborhood
24.plot: We'll discover why rats and mice are such great city-dwellers...see what sticky-fingered deer are stealing from campers...and find out just how neighborly a heard of elephants can be.

25.title: Ocean Life
25.plot: We'll dive to the depths of the ocean to discover some of those mysteries of the deep - listen to a whale of a tale - and discover how life survives in a tide pool.

26.title: Night and Day
26.plot: We'll wake up with a rooster...take a mid-day siesta with an elephant...and stay up all night with a mountain lion.

1.title: Wild Cats
1.plot: We'll sprint, leap, and roar with some wild cats. We'll also find out...which one is the biggest...which is the fastest...and if any of them, despite their fearsome reputations, purr.

2.title: Animal Legends
2.plot: We'll investigate animal legends. We'll also find out why snakes have a bad reputation...which animal holds the world on its back...and, how a dog became the first animal to travel into space.

3.title: Extreme Habitats
3.plot: We'll discover how animals survive in the world's most extreme environments. We'll also meet a mammal that never drinks water...find out how a seal that swims among icebergs can overheat...and what ocean creatures has 7-inch long teeth.

4.title: Life at the River
4.plot: We'll ride the river to discover the animals that make waterways their homes. From enormous hippos...to ferocious crocodiles...to the world's largest rodents. We'll also find out what sends river fish into a feeding frenzy.

5.title: Amazing Adaptations
5.plot: We'll discover how animals survive using some amazing adaptations. We'll also find out...which animal eats rocks...which animal makes its own dog repellent...and which animal can survive the vacuum of space.

6.title: Animals of the World: Africa
6.plot: We'll find out what makes a camel so good at crossing the desert...ask why meerkats join the mob...figure out how to find monkeys in the forest...and get up close and personal with the most amazing animals of Africa.

7.title: Animals of the Americas Before Man
7.plot: We're going to explore what the Americas looked like a million years ago...long before humans, and meet the incredible animals that lived there.

8.title: Animal Facts, Animal Fictions
8.plot: We'll separate fact from fiction by finding out what separates man from the monkeys...if opossums can hang their tails...if dolphins have names of each other...and if wolves really do howl at the moon.

9.title: Insects and Spiders
9.plot: We're going to zoom in close on some of the world's most amazing insects...and spiders. We'll discover what mosquito's do with all that blood they drink...find which insect is loud enough to damage your hearing and more.

10.title: Where They Came From: Reptiles and Amphibians
10.plot: We'll dig into the fossil record to investigate the origin of reptiles...and amphibians. Can you imagine a frog at the top of the food chain? What about a fish that breathes air? Answers to these questions and more.

11.title: Super Carnivores
11.plot: We're talking predators. You'll meet the biggest - toughest...and most terrifying carnivores on Earth. Get ready for Great whites, lions, tigers, komodo dragons, polar bears, wolves, and many more fierce animals.

12.title: Animals of the World: Americas
12.plot: We'll follow in the footsteps of Christopher Columbus and see the Americas in a whole new way...by meeting the animals that lived there a long time ago.

13.title: Animals of Australia Before Man
13.plot: We'll investigate animals that lived in Australia long before people showed up. Including a giant kangaroo that could hop and never had to stop, an animal with the most powerful bite and more.

14.title: Animals in Color
14.plot: We'll ask who the peacock is trying to impress? What makes the flamingo pink? And where you can find twin snakes. Get ready to meet dozens of animals that sport the most amazing colors.

15.title: Zoos Now and Then
15.plot: We'll learn how zoos have adapted and changed over time. From the construction plans of medieval castles to the modern zoos of today.

16.title: Animals of the World: Asia
16.plot: We'll trek across Asia on the back of a camel, travel back through history with the domestic cat, and ride into mythology on the back of a dragon.

17.title: Taking Flight
17.plot: We're taking to the air to discover what it's really like to fly. Find out if birds really do come from dinosaurs, how long a bird can fly before it has to land and what's up with birds that have wings, but can't fly?

18.title: Great Migrations
18.plot: We'll investigate some of the animal worlds greatest migrations and discover how animals know where they're going even if they've never been there before.

19.title: Animals of Asia, Africa, and Europe Before Man
19.plot: We'll investigate some of the animals that lived in Africa, Asia, and Europe in the time after the dinosaurs but before we arrived.

20.title: Animals Who Are Not What They Seem
20.plot: We'll discover dozens of animals that aren't quite what they seem. We'll also meet an animal that glues plants to itself, another that disguises itself as a hummingbird, and discover why that leaf...is moving.

21.title: Life in the Forest
21.plot: We'll investigate some of the incredible animals that have evolved for a life in the forest.

22.title: The Greatest Places to See Animals
22.plot: We're traveling the globe in search of the best places to see wildlife. From birds to the beasts.

23.title: Animal Encounters
23.plot: We'll investigate some downright amazing animal encounters. Some good. And some not so good. Plus, we'll meet some famous animals of Hollywood and a crime fighting alligator.

24.title: Animal Geography
24.plot: We'll investigate why animals live in some of the crazy places that they do. We'll also discover how an animal's geography helps shape its evolution.

25.title: How Animals Protect Themselves
25.plot: We'll discover some of the amazing ways that animals protect themselves. Plus, we'll meet an animal that writes it's own prescriptions, wake up the sleepiest rodent on the planet and learn to respect the skunk .

26.title: Fast and Slow
26.plot: We'll discover why some animals are fast, and some are slow. We'll also meet a couple of record holders, including the fastest animal on the planet, and the sleepiest.

imdb.title: Zoo Clues
plot: Amazing animal facts and fun trivia for children, adults, and families.::Brock Scott
